text: hi guys it's angel today I'm sharing my
first cookie recipe with you they are
persimmon almond thumbprint cookies
using these fresh persimmons that I have
now if you're not familiar with
persimmons or you've never had them
before
they are an Asian fruit and they're
typically best eaten when they're
crunchy I know that sounds kind of weird
but they are kind of hard and crunchy on
the inside but they're really good and
when they're right they're really sweet
now that's perfect because we are going
to be making a homemade persimmon jam
and then we're going to be topping it
and putting that onto our almond
thumbprint cookies it is going to be
super delicious I promise and really
easy and healthy so with that let's get
started first the ingredients for the
fruit jam will need three super ripe
persimmons three tablespoons of filtered
water 1/4 cup of cane sugar and finally
three teaspoons of lemon juice start by
prepping the persimmons by removing the
tops and peeling the skin then cut the
fruit into smaller pieces it doesn't
need to be exact cents will be pureeing
them later
next add the fruit to a blender or food
processor add your water and blend and
chop until it's your desired consistency
I like to puree mine until it's smooth
after that it's time to cook
bring your persimmon puree to a simmer
and add in your cane sugar and lemon
juice mix and stir until well combined
and continue to simmer and cook for 10
to 15 minutes until the mixture starts
to thicken when it's slightly thickened
it should be this consistency after that
transfer the persimmon jam to a
container and let it cool before using
cooling will also allow it to thicken
even more while we're waiting on that
let's make the cookie dough start with 2
cups of almond flour 1/4 teaspoon of
salt 1/4 teaspoon of baking soda and
sift those dry ingredients together
first before adding 3 tablespoons of
coconut oil 2 tablespoons of honey and
finally 1 whole egg mix and combine
those together to make your dough and
when you're done it should look like
this
then roll and divide your dough into
equal pieces I like bigger cookies so
I'm going to make eight larger ones but
it's totally up to you
next roll each piece into a ball and
place them on a nonstick cooking sheet
then gently press with your thumbs so
there's an indentation in the center now
let's check on our jam it should have
cooled and thickened in texture using a
small spoon carefully fill the top of
each cookie with the persimmon spread
then bake in a preheated oven at 350
degrees for 12 to 15 minutes or until
golden brown once they're done don't
forget to transfer them to a cookie rack
for cooling before serving and eating
so that's how easy it is to make these
four simin almond thumbprint cookies now
if you don't want to go through all the
hassle to make your own persimmon jam I
totally understand you can also
interchange and use like a blueberry
spread or strawberry spread that you buy
from the store it'll absolutely work
with this thumbprint cookie recipe so
now for the taste test
that is one good cookie I love how it's
not too sweet and there's that taste of
the persimmons and it goes really well
with the almond flour and it's healthy
too I'm angel thank you guys so much for
watching and if you do try this recipe
at home don't forget to snap a photo
with your phone and tag me on social
media I definitely want to see how these
cookies turned out for you until then
I'll see you guys soon bye
